story:
ALLIVA TALKING ALERT CABLE with SUPER FAST Charging 

Most of us normally charge our mobile handsets by connecting to a power socket / power Bank during the day or night, however if the charger is not connected properly or there is problem in the socket connection / handset connection, or after connecting, you simply forget to switch the charger on. This results in the handset not charged fully or not charged at all during the day, or in the morning when you wake up.  

Function & Features of ALLIVA TALKING ALERT CABLE with SUPER FAST Charging





Myths/Facts  regarding SUPER FAST charging cable function 

Do you  know why certain USB cables are unable to charge your mobile handsets. Some cables can charge but at a very slow rate, some just work as fine as the original USB cable that come with your phone, and some can even charge faster than the original cable. lets understand Why this happens.  

There are 5 wires inside the USB 1 and USB 2 cables, and there are more inside USB 3.0 cable. Since most of the mobile phones nowadays are using USB 2.0 connector, so USB 3.0 is out of our topic here.

The 5 wires are:

· 2x 28 AWG data lines

· 2 x 20-28 AWG power conductors

· 1x drain wire

and those 5 wires are connected to the 5 pins in your micro-USB connector.

In fact, there are two kinds of USB cable:fully-rated and sub-channel.The main difference between them is that fully-rated cable can be used for typical peripherals operating at the rate of 480 Mbps (high speed) signaling, while the sub-channel one at the rate of 1.5 Mbps (standard speed) signaling. The construction inside the cable fully-rated and sub-channel cable is different.

The first code is normally the specification of the data signal pair, which is normally 28 AWG. "2C" means 2 conductors, and "1P" or "1Pr" means 1 pair. "2C" and "1P" are basically the same. It turns out that the wire thickness used inside the cable impacts on the resistance of the cable assembly – this resistance causes energy loss inside the cable when an attached load draws a current, and causes a voltage drop which can reduce the voltage to the end device to a point where it is not possible to charge quickly or completely

The important part is the second code, which is the specification of the power distribution pair. The minimum requirement is 28 AWG, and the lower the AWG number the better. This is because lower AWG wire is thicker, and therefore the electrical resistant is lower.

Therefore, charging with a "28AWG/1P + 28AWG/2C" USB cable is normally slower than a"28AWG/1P + 20AWG/2C" cable. Which is fastest

For Best Result 20 AWG is the best  



Here is Technical explanation Why 28/20 AWG cable is Best (even at 5 Meters in 20 AWG cable there is negligibe Voltage Drop ) Please See Below. It is technical in nature, However Gough Lui  has explained in a most simple manner.  Some selected text from his blog (with his permission) is reproduced below to explan users the importance of a Quality Cable.

Gough Lui has explained in the most simplistic manner with color coded tables. Please check out his Blog which explains in details and though technically we know the product in & out, we would not have been able to explain it so beautifully  to you. here is the link to his article  http://goughlui.com/2014/10/01/usb-cable-resistance-why-your-phonetablet-might-be-charging-slow/  

But how bad is it really? Lets do some basic calculations to find out.

The Calculations

The thickness of USB cable conductors is normally specified in American Wire Gauge (AWG). In this system, larger numbers indicate thinner wires. As the USB specification makes reference to AWG numbers of 20, 22, 24, 26 and 28, calculations were performed for these AWG figures.

The data used in calculations is summarized above. The conductor resistance is taken from Wikipedia and assumes a copper conductor. The USB contact resistance of 30mohm is a “middle of the road” figure – many connectors specify 10mohm when new, and 30mohm through their lifetime, although 50mohm is acceptable for micro connectors.

The voltage drop is derived from ohm’s law – Voltage = Current * Resistance.

The resistance itself is calculated by the route length which is twice the length of the cable (as current travels from the charger to the device and back). For the one with contact resistance, four times the contact resistance is added to compensate for the charger positive, device positive, device negative and charger negative contacts.

This figure is in mohms, and is divided by 1000 to get to ohms, and then finally multiplied by current in amps to get the voltage drop.

The Results

The results are color coded as to their voltage loss. For a  5V output, the USB specification demands that the voltage remains within 5% (i.e. an acceptable voltage drop of 0.25v). All voltage drops less than 0.25v are colour coded green. From there, voltage drops of between 0.25v up to 0.5v are colour coded yellow. This is because, while the USB specifications are stringent, most devices only require 4.2v – 4.35v at the battery to fully charge. Most chargers are of the linear or buck (step-down) type, and thus the supply voltage must be greater than the battery voltage for charging to happen. Accounting for losses in the charging circuit, it is determined that approximately 4.5v is required to ensure a full charge. Any losses greater than 0.5v are colored red, as they are likely to cause problems.

With Contact Resistance

With contact resistance taken into account, it can be seen that it is difficult to meet requirements at high currents of 2A and 2.4A. As a result, cables only up to about 50 cm can be used with 24 AWG, or maybe even 1M with boosted source voltage. This is most significant for tablets.

For smartphones, with a requirement closer to 1 A, 24 AWG wires up to 2M could be sufficient, or 1 M at 26 AWG, and 50 cm at 28 AWG.

However, at 500 mA (the original spec), it can be seen that it is possible to meet the stringent USB voltage requirement at every length with 20 AWG wire, and 2M with 24 AWG (probably by design).

The disadvantage of pushing more current at low voltages is very clear – the resistance causes power loss very quickly!

A corollary of this is that if you have a 3M cable, of 24 AWG, then it’s likely your charge current is not going to exceed 1A (it’s probably 500mA-1A) purely because of the voltage drop that is caused by the cable.

Without Contact Resistance

If we assume that connector resistance isn't part of the equation, and look at the wires itself, the situation is a little less stringent, at high currents, but still illustrates the difficulty in keeping voltage drop under control.

One caveat of this, is that some vendors have realized the issue and decided to push the output voltage up to 5.1v or 5.2v, which is still within USB specification but allows for an extra 0.1-0.2v voltage drop. This is a potentially nice feature as it means the requirements on the cables are slightly relaxed (i.e. maybe even 0.7v voltage drop is tolerable).

It is also possible to see higher charge currents at the expense of voltage drop when the cell is fully discharged at 3v, as a ~3.2v input would be enough to start charging. Likewise, as the cell reaches full charge, the current tapers off, thus reducing the voltage drop. This might be happening already with some cables “pushing” what is possible. You know when it’s pushed too far when it doesn't consistently charge fully (i.e. stuck at 94%, when eliminating all other issues). "ARTICLE Ends"


We love to challenge ourselves and During Prototype testing we decided to use only UL approved 28/20 AWG  cable for this project. (as with UL approval the Quality Is guaranteed and no markup or fake is possible). Also Europe, US, Canada, Australia give higher mileage and acceptance to UL approved Products.

Full Working Prototype Video

Where Are We With The Development?

As of today, we have finalized completely the electronics, PCB design, Cable Gauge & Supplier/Manufacturer  etc  of the TALKING ALERT CABLE  The Cable 28/20 with Audio Alerts in English has been tested and is working. In plain English: we have the unit, it works well, and we are going to keep making it better. This isn't a product in  Air; it’s a device that we have been using ourselves for past 60 days and given to BETA testers also, without any complaints  We have been Looking at Improvising the cable, connectors & add more languages to make even better, before it is finally delivered . We’re perfectionists. You’re putting your money into a device that even in its current state can be shipped and there will be takers for the same,. Not us. We have our Goodwill of 5 Decades at stake.

Below is The Our R &D Labs  and Testing Area



Okay, enough about the Product and Features. We have been working on Innovative and path Breaking The Industrial design is complete, and most of the pictures you see above are real.  What you see is what you get  - but it’ll be much better after the tooling will be made  and the parts will be injected.Our Major challenge is USB connector Design  

As far as the PCB Engineering & design d goes, we are in the last stages of tweaking and improving it. We have UL approved cable in Place, MFI Application & connectors Ordered (MFI Connectors are same and required for LED charge Indicator cable and Cube 16 Power Banks www.allivaglobal.com)  and now only looking at improvising.Long before our anticipated delivery date of the ALLIVA TALKING ALERT cable in June 1st Week, we will have completed and fully tested our product. 

We will be Using Gold Plated Connectors, at both ends and FLAT tangle free cable in Black and White colors (maybe other Colors can be considered later) (your Suggestion and feedback is Important to us)


This is the Cable we have finalized, We  want to offer you the best and now looking at offering Silicon Covered USB connector as the connector needs to have speaker cut out and a small button. Only the USB connector we are looking at improvising any suggestions or comments will be appreciated. Silicon/or Gloss finish?

   


The MICRO USB/iPhone 5/6 Connector we have frozen on white Plastic Body with Blue LED Ring at end. LED glows while phone is charging and shuts off when charging stops. 



TALKING ALERT CABLE STORY


Hi, I’m Moazzam Loynmoon, the Designer of the TALKING ALERT cable I’ have been designing & marketing Test & measurement Instruments like Oscilloscopes, Signal generators etc So we are not here to ask for your valuable time & money, unless and until we have the prototype and working model of the product with all necessary testing and certifications in place.

.My father started the company International Electronics in 1957. We have supplied to DEFENCE, Bhabha Atomic Research Center (B.A.R.C.) TATA Institute of Fundamental Research(T.I.F.R), to name a few.

In Those days itself our products were very unique. My dad was also very innovative, In 80’s we supplied Signal generators to PHILIPS in their brand name. Since the time I turned 11 years of age after school I used to assist my dad and learnt a lot as a kid. For the past 40 years designing instruments using innovation & aesthetics  has been my passion.& I make sure that all my product designs are user friendly My computer based instruments software is also designed to be user friendly.

In the year 2010 my Son Hussain Loynmoon graduated with Telecom Engineering Degree and Allwind Technologies was born, With him joining me We ventured into Renewable Energy Product & Solutions, we ventured into LED, SOLAR, & Wind Power and started manufacturing LED lighting and executing SOLAR and Wind Power projects. With joining of Pranav Sayta in 2014 to our team and he having almsot 16 years of thinking out of Box we added  Innovative Mobile Accessories designing & development, Our first product was SLIM PB 42 (slimmest power bank in world at just 4.16 mm & 2000 mAh lithium Polymer Battery.with charging of 1.5 A against normal 1 A in most power banks) it was indeed a challenge to make it so slim and with inbuilt cable.this has been recently launched. In India and shortly being introduced across the Globe in coming months )

In short "The word impossible, does not exist in my dictionary, I will not sell something which I myself would not be willing to buy". I want my products to perform beyond your expectations.

The idea for the Talking alert cable came to Hussain from one of the most common problems faced by him, while charging mobile handsets. Most of us normally charge our mobile handsets by connecting to a power socket/power bank during the day or night, however if the charger is not connected properly or there is a problem in the socket connection /handset connection, or after connection, you simply forget to switch the charger on. This results in the handset not being charged fully or not charged at all.

Naturally, We as a team decided to create a Talking Alert Cable which would give Voice Alerts in the English language every 15 minutes. Every time you connect the USB or Micro USB/iPhone connector to the Handset/Socket, and also rather than looking at the mobile screen just press a small touch button, which will speak out the charging time elapsed.

I have seen my father waking up in middle of night, and checking once or twice to see if the phone is charging or not, and thus disturbing his sleep . In this day and age we cannot think of being without an operational Mobile Handset.  We discussed and decided to create a solution.

Looking at the market, no competition existed, but we are committed to giving the best possible product at the most economical price. It has taken us  6 months to get the TALKING alert cable to this level. We didn’t want to start the campaign until we had a functional prototype with added SuperFast charging cable that was approaching completion. Otherwise we’d be letting you down. We want this cable to become indispensable to such a degree that you will start recommending the cable to all your friends and family to ensure that they have worry free sleep at night.

So, where's the money going?

Production and Shipping.

All the Leg Work is complete. Now we have to put it into production. All Quality vendors have been finalized. Sequence of Purchase.  Quality control, Assembly and Final Testing is in place. Your money will be utilized in Purchase of raw material, Production, QC, Shipping costs, Warehousing Cost, as well as certification of the final product. Please note our shipping costs will be high since material is to be shipped from INDIA. We intend to expedite the process of manufacture and delivery so that you get maximum benefits.   We shall not let you down.

THE RISK AND CHALLENGES

Our experienced team has developed many complex products in the last 45 years. Moazzam Loynmoon, our founder has spent 45 years in designing, sourcing and manufacturing products ,

Recently We just completed the Slimmest Power Bank project  (SLIM PB 42 & CUBE 16 Power banks with Micro USB and Apple iPhone 5/6 (8 pin Lightning connectors MFI Approved). We have been working on Alliva Talking Alert cable for past 6 months . Throughout the course of R&D, we have created several iterations &  prototypes and have continuously improved their functionality and quality.

We have a team of 14 people working in R & D at Allwind Technologies & SIGNET.

We understand that Indiegogo backers want their ALLIVA Talking Alert Cable as soon as possible, and on time, but perfection  is at the top of the list. Even though we are confident of meeting our deadline for delivery, there are always unforeseen circumstances, or minor changes that could cause delays. We will always be here & never fail to answer your questions,

We are dedicated to our timeline and ALLIVA TALKING Cable’s quality, and will keep you informed on the status of our the project’s progress at regular Intervals by email and will continue to send further updates as we have them. We are committed to being transparent and keeping ALLIVA Talking Cable fans and Indiegogo backers informed.
story_txt:
ALLIVA TALKING ALERT CABLE with SUPER FAST Charging Most of us normally charge our mobile handsets by connecting to a power socket / power Bank during the day or night, however if the charger is not connected properly or there is problem in the socket connection / handset connection, or after connecting, you simply forget to switch the charger on. This results in the handset not charged fully or not charged at all during the day, or in the morning when you wake up.  Function & Features of ALLIVA TALKING ALERT CABLE with SUPER FAST Charging
Myths/Facts  regarding SUPER FAST charging cable function 
Do you  know why certain USB cables are unable to charge your mobile handsets. Some cables can charge but at a very slow rate, some just work as fine as the original USB cable that come with your phone, and some can even charge faster than the original cable. lets understand Why this happens.  
There are
5 wires inside the USB 1 and USB 2 cables, and there are more inside USB
3.0 cable. Since most of the mobile phones nowadays are using USB 2.0 connector,
so USB 3.0 is out of our topic here.
The 5 wires are:
· 2x 28 AWG data lines
· 2 x
20-28 AWG power conductors
· 1x
drain wire
and those 5 wires
are connected to the 5 pins in your micro-USB connector.

In fact, there are two kinds of USB cable:fully-rated and sub-channel.The main difference between them is
that fully-rated cable can be used for typical peripherals operating at the
rate of 480 Mbps (high speed) signaling, while the sub-channel one at the
rate of 1.5 Mbps (standard speed) signaling. The construction inside the
cable fully-rated and sub-channel cable is different.
The first code is
normally the specification of the data signal pair, which is normally 28 AWG.
"2C" means 2 conductors, and "1P" or "1Pr" means
1 pair. "2C" and "1P" are basically the
same. It turns out that the wire thickness
used inside the cable impacts on the resistance of the cable assembly – this
resistance causes energy loss inside the cable when an attached load draws a
current, and causes a voltage drop which
can reduce the voltage to the end device to a point where it is not
possible to charge quickly or completely

The important part is the second code, which is the specification of the power
distribution pair. The minimum requirement is 28 AWG, and the
lower the AWG number the better. This is because lower AWG wire is thicker, and therefore the electrical
resistant is lower.
Therefore, charging
with a "28AWG/1P + 28AWG/2C" USB cable is normally slower than a"28AWG/1P +
20AWG/2C" cable. Which is fastest


For Best Result 20
AWG is the best  

Here is Technical explanation Why
28/20 AWG cable is Best (even at 5 Meters in 20 AWG cable there is negligibe Voltage
Drop ) Please See Below. It is technical in nature, However Gough Lui  has explained in a most simple manner.  Some selected text from his blog (with his permission) is reproduced below to explan users the importance of a Quality Cable.
Gough Lui has explained in the most simplistic manner with color coded tables. Please check out his Blog which explains in details and though technically we know the product in & out, we would not have been able to explain it so beautifully  to you. here is the link to his article  http://goughlui.com/2014/10/01/usb-cable-resistance-why-your-phonetablet-might-be-charging-slow/  But how bad is it really? Lets do some basic calculations to find out.The CalculationsThe thickness of USB cable conductors is normally specified in American Wire Gauge (AWG). In this system, larger numbers indicate thinner wires. As the USB specification makes reference to AWG numbers of 20, 22, 24, 26 and 28, calculations were performed for these AWG figures.The data used in calculations is summarized above. The conductor resistance is taken from Wikipedia and assumes a copper conductor. The USB contact resistance of 30mohm is a “middle of the road” figure – many connectors specify 10mohm when new, and 30mohm through their lifetime, although 50mohm is acceptable for micro connectors.The voltage drop is derived from ohm’s law – Voltage = Current * Resistance.The resistance itself is calculated by the route length which is twice the length of the cable (as current travels from the charger to the device and back). For the one with contact resistance, four times the contact resistance is added to compensate for the charger positive, device positive, device negative and charger negative contacts.This figure is in mohms, and is divided by 1000 to get to ohms, and then finally multiplied by current in amps to get the voltage drop.The ResultsThe results are color coded as to their voltage loss. For a  5V output, the USB specification demands that the voltage remains within 5% (i.e. an acceptable voltage drop of 0.25v). All voltage drops less than 0.25v are colour coded green. From there, voltage drops of between 0.25v up to 0.5v are colour coded yellow. This is because, while the USB specifications are stringent, most devices only require 4.2v – 4.35v at the battery to fully charge. Most chargers are of the linear or buck (step-down) type, and thus the supply voltage must be greater than the battery voltage for charging to happen. Accounting for losses in the charging circuit, it is determined that approximately 4.5v is required to ensure a full charge. Any losses greater than 0.5v are colored red, as they are likely to cause problems.With Contact ResistanceWith contact resistance taken into account, it can be seen that it is difficult to meet requirements at high currents of 2A and 2.4A. As a result, cables only up to about 50 cm can be used with 24 AWG, or maybe even 1M with boosted source voltage. This is most significant for tablets.For smartphones, with a requirement closer to 1 A, 24 AWG wires up to 2M could be sufficient, or 1 M at 26 AWG, and 50 cm at 28 AWG.However, at 500 mA (the original spec), it can be seen that it is possible to meet the stringent USB voltage requirement at every length with 20 AWG wire, and 2M with 24 AWG (probably by design).The disadvantage of pushing more current at low voltages is very clear – the resistance causes power loss very quickly!A corollary of this is that if you have a 3M cable, of 24 AWG, then it’s likely your charge current is not going to exceed 1A (it’s probably 500mA-1A) purely because of the voltage drop that is caused by the cable.Without Contact ResistanceIf we assume that connector resistance isn't part of the equation, and look at the wires itself, the situation is a little less stringent, at high currents, but still illustrates the difficulty in keeping voltage drop under control.One caveat of this, is that some vendors have realized the issue and decided to push the output voltage up to 5.1v or 5.2v, which is still within USB specification but allows for an extra 0.1-0.2v voltage drop. This is a potentially nice feature as it means the requirements on the cables are slightly relaxed (i.e. maybe even 0.7v voltage drop is tolerable).It is also possible to see higher charge currents at the expense of voltage drop when the cell is fully discharged at 3v, as a ~3.2v input would be enough to start charging. Likewise, as the cell reaches full charge, the current tapers off, thus reducing the voltage drop. This might be happening already with some cables “pushing” what is possible. You know when it’s pushed too far when it doesn't consistently charge fully (i.e. stuck at 94%, when eliminating all other issues). "ARTICLE Ends"
We love to challenge ourselves and During
Prototype testing we decided to use only UL approved 28/20 AWG  cable for
this project. (as with UL approval the Quality Is guaranteed and no markup or fake is possible). Also Europe, US, Canada, Australia give higher mileage and acceptance to UL approved Products.
Full Working Prototype
Video


Where Are We With The Development?
As of today, we have
finalized completely the electronics, PCB design, Cable Gauge &
Supplier/Manufacturer  etc  of the TALKING ALERT CABLE  The Cable
28/20 with Audio Alerts in English has been tested and is working. In plain
English: we have the unit, it works well, and we are going to keep making it
better. This isn't a product in  Air; it’s a device that we have been
using ourselves for past 60 days and given to BETA testers also, without any complaints  We have been
Looking at Improvising the cable, connectors & add more languages to make even
better, before it is finally delivered . We’re perfectionists. You’re putting
your money into a device that even in its current state can be shipped and there will be takers for the same,. Not us. We have our Goodwill of 5 Decades at stake.Below is The Our R &D Labs  and Testing Area
Okay, enough about
the Product and Features. We have been working on Innovative and path Breaking
The Industrial design is complete, and most of the pictures you see above are
real.  What you see is what you get  - but it’ll be much better after
the tooling will be made  and the parts will be injected.Our Major
challenge is USB connector Design  
As far as the PCB Engineering &
design d goes, we are in the last stages of tweaking and improving it. We have
UL approved cable in Place, MFI Application & connectors Ordered (MFI
Connectors are same and required for LED charge Indicator cable and Cube 16
Power Banks www.allivaglobal.com)  and now only looking at
improvising.Long before our anticipated delivery date of the ALLIVA TALKING ALERT cable in June
1st Week, we will have completed and fully tested our product. 
We will be Using Gold Plated Connectors, at both ends and FLAT
tangle free cable in Black and White colors (maybe other Colors can be
considered later) (your Suggestion and feedback is Important to us)
This is the Cable we have finalized, We  want to offer you the best and now looking at offering Silicon Covered USB connector as the connector needs to have speaker cut out and a small button. Only the USB connector we are looking at improvising any suggestions or comments will be appreciated. Silicon/or Gloss finish?   The MICRO USB/iPhone 5/6 Connector we have frozen on white Plastic Body with Blue LED Ring at end. LED glows while phone is charging and shuts off when charging stops.

story:
GENERATIONS OF CHAIRVISOR:

  • Generation 1 (Indiegogo Price $75)
  • Generation 2 (Indiegogo Price $110)
  • Generation 3 (Coming Soon to Indiegogo)



WHERE CAN YOU USE CHAIRVISOR?
ChairVisor is perfect for poolside and more! Usages are limitless. See a few settings that are ideal for ChairVisor, below.


WHEN CAN YOU EXPECT YOUR CHAIRVISOR?
Once fully funded, ChairVisor is aiming for a consumer arrival in August 2016.

WHO ARE THE PEOPLE BEHIND CHAIRVISOR?
 ChairVisor's staff is comprised of local Chula Vista (San Diego, CA) residents who are dedicated to their community and determined to see another great product launch from such a great city.


The Impact

All sun lover's know at one point or another we need to protect the most sensitive parts of the body, our face. We want a simple, compact device that's not cumbersome and easy to use.  Wouldn't it also be nice to have such a device when staying at a Luxury hotel and they to offer this personal shade accessory that will make your stay at poolside more pleasurable. What about that active individual that wants to take a few moments to relax at poolside, at the beach or even while watching the kids play sports but need to stay connected via their personal smart devices.  ChairVisor is a user friendly quick, compact accessory that solves the low smart device battery issue one encounters at inconvenient times. The solar frame solves the charging problem easy & conveniently while relaxing. 

Risks & Challenges
We have met all our challenges head on and have overcome them.  I have successfully completed the most difficult segments of ChairVisor and they were:
  • Securing the patent. Chair Visor is fully patented & trademarked
  • Engineering design & manufacturing prototypes of the first & second generation to evaluate ChairVisor's functionality & practicality. 
  • Researched tooling & manufacturers options for best pricing. 
  • Use of high grade DuPONT plastic, stainless steel and Sunbrella material for durability, sustainability
  • Designed and implemented ChairVisor's mood board, pallet colors and website design & vision. 
  • Established the demand for ChairVisor through a marketing analysis and strategy with a successful test market at a local Southern California Hilton Hotel and "what a hit" said the food & beverage direct.  
  • Assembled an awesome management team, sales team that will manage the day to day business needs with ecommerce/online sales.  
  • We are now at a point to bring ChairVisor to the retail market and to all our fans that have supported us and want to see ChairVisor come to fruition. We have met all our challenges head on and have overcome them all. Now we need your help!  

Ways You Can Help  

Anyone can help us to get ChairVisor into the retail market by choosing one of the special perks we have design for you.  

Some of our ChairVisor fans are unable to contribute by picking a perk, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Everyone we touch with ChairVisor can help us by sharing our Indiegogo campaign.  Help us to spread the word to reach the masses. Please "like" us, "share" and "invite" all your friends and family to visit us on facebook, Instagram, & twitter.

story:
MiniMe is a portable high-end boombox totally sustainable, wireless and funky, but with character. It is designed and built to last for many years with all the modern functionalities in mind but with high aesthetics as well. Its housing is made entirely with solid wood and is customizable to a great extend. It may seem small but the sound it produces is powerful. It is like having two full-range HiFi speakers in one! MiniMe is here to beat reality. What you'll get, modestly speaking, is even better from what you see. It is truly a piece of art!

Click Here For High Resolution Images




Use Bluetooth to wirelessly stream music: MiniMe plays music from your personal collection through your smartphone, tablet, laptop or PC. Do you want more? With MiniMe's Bluetooth you can access the illimitable music collection the online streaming sites can offer.

WiFi enabled: Equipped with a powerful single-board computer that runs Linux and Kodi (XBMC) MiniMe when connected to a TV can be turned into an Open Source Media Center and can stream HD movies, music and play games.

Take it everywhere with you: MiniMe is light and portable and has an 8-hour battery life.You can take it from the comfort of your house wherever you go.

Fill any room in your home with your personal touch: By pressing its nose, MiniMe wakes up and sings your songs, plays your movies even your guitar tunes.

Unique craftsmanship: Without boasting, we can say that the team behind MiniMe has endlessly worked to produce a state of the art product. When we say sustainable we completely mean it. And as far as design is concerned we don't have to say anything. You can see it with your very eyes.

Wood selection: MiniMe comes in 6 different types of wood and 6 different colors. Standard Series: Mahogany and Maple. Premium Series: Oak and  Walnut. Super Deluxe Series: Wenge and Rosewood. Select the type and color that suits you best. 

Customizable to a great extend: When our goal is fulfilled you would be able to order your own special characteristics on MiniMe. Be it eye graphics, led lights, custom volume knobs and many more!

 

             

ON/OFF


Bass reflex

Portable


Bluetooth


Media Center


Stereo Line-in


Guitar amplifier

Mil-Spec electronics



Sustainable Construction & Design



Lifetime Guarantee






                                           
                                              Click Here For High Resolution Images
                 



528Hertz  full-range Electrostatic speaker close-up preview

Since we are highly skilled individuals, we put great emphasis in detail and sustainability. We choose to produce almost everything in-house (apart from some commercial electronics) to maintain our high quality standards. So far, throughout our working years we have fund everything ourselves and due to lack of sufficient capital everything is done totally D.I.Y. (tooling, molds, jigs, PCB's, integration of electronics and testing). We have even "built" our own robots for CNC prototyping.

Our 6 axis robot Cnc in action

Though, living in a country (Greece) plunged in a deep economic crisis, crowdfunding seems to be the only feasible way to reach our goal. Sustainability, design and the high quality of sound is our passion. However, there will always be improvements and innovations that need to be made. Crowdfunding will help us acquire new tooling and machinery that will lower the endless working hours, it will also help 528Hertz become a viable company aspiring to produce more unique projects, plus a wider market would help us test our product and receive feedback.


An estimated budget breakdown analysis is featured in the pie chart below:




Old-school meets new tech...


We have been working for the last 2 years not only to produce MiniMe and our other unique handmade perks but we have also built our in-house production line.

At this stage MiniMe is a fully working prototype that does everything that claims it does. Being though at a limited budget we are at a point that we totally rely on your help to:

  • Order raw materials (both electronic & organic) in large quantities to keep prices as low as possible.

  •  Make some additional molds for large scale production that need to be done and are truly expensive.

  •  Finalize the MiniMe packaging.

                     

   

We love challenges and we are good at  problem-solving be it mechanical or electronics engineering. Designing and building hardware for a small team like us is nearly impossible but we are here to prove you and us wrong! We are confident that will overcome any obstacle in our way but to have everything ready for shipping on time is our main concern and our number one priority. Pledging and supporting us you can help us make this possible.

MANUFACTURING:  There are many manufacturing challenges most of which have been already overcome, but to produce on a larger scale will require increased tooling and production equipment and this is where some delay may occur.

FULFILLMENT: Despite our best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction, transport delays or supplier setbacks. Moreover, If more people than we anticipate make purchases we may have to scale up the production process and hire more personnel. We are ready to work hard to produce MiniMes the quickest possible and ensure that the early backers are given priority to receive their goodies.

ADDITIONAL ADJUSTMENTS: Although extensive testing on the design and liability of the product has taken place over the past two years and we think we have a product that is ready for the market, there will always be new things to add to reach perfection. New adjustments along the way are possible in order to deliver the highest quality to all of our supporters. This will result in a better product but may delay production or shipment in some cases.



The team behind MiniMe is a bunch of guys full of love with what they do and fully in love with technology, high-end constructions and passion for music and High Fidelity. Each member of the team has their own technical background and every bit of their knowledge is filtered and distilled into their products.

Although MiniMe is our very first official product on the market, as a team we have spent the last 5 years experimenting with High-Definition Audio as a hobby in our free time. Throughout this process of endless R&D we have designed and built from scratch (3) pairs of ultra High-Definition Electrostatic speakers and our current love MiniMe!

                            Our other finished projects first time on air




 


 





                     Wow Workshop              RAS Automation                Hackerspace






 

IN THE BOX

MiniMe is unique inside-out. Its packaging is completely safe and funky including:

  • A power cord

  • A strap to carry MiniMe

  • Instructions manual

PURCHASING & SHIPPING

(Delivery dates, Shipping, Warranty)

Does MiniMe Ship internationally?

Yes. We ship all over the globe.

Is shipping included?

Shipping is free worldwide for all our perks. Unfortunately this doesn't apply to MiniMe.

How much does shipping cost?

$45 dollars for European shipping and $65 dollars for global shipping (countries out of Europe). However, the more we sell the lower this figure will become. There is no need to pay for shipping now, we will update you on this with more accurate estimates based on volume. We'll send you a reminder about shipping cost before we start dispatching your goodies.

(Purchasers are responsible for any VAT or customs duties levied by their own countries)

How do I pay for shipping?

Shipping invoices will be payable with PayPal. A receipt will be sent to your email address prior to dispatch.

Can I pick MiniMe up in Athens?

Yes! Local pickup is free and highly recommended, we would love to meet you! Our workshop is based near the Central Athens Airport (El. Venizelos) so it is easy to locate us and pick up your goodies on the spot.

When will i receive MiniMe?

Estimated dates can be found on our timeline's perk section. We are planning to start shipping the first MiniMe units in November 2015. After the campaign ends and everything is confirmed we will keep you updated for all the final details!

Is there a warranty?

Lifetime guarantee for MiniMe's wooden housing and 1 year limited liability warranty on electronics are offered.

PORTABILITY

(Size, Battery life)

How portable is MiniMe?

Absolutely. Using its specially designed strap you can carry it everywhere with style.

Does it have an internal battery?

Yes, MiniMe comes with an internal battery that recharges when plugged in. It lasts for 8+ hours and it takes about 3-4 hours to charge.

COMPATIBILITY

(Wireless & Wired sources)

What kind of device do I need to stream music wirelessly?

Any device that has Bluetooth or WiFi including your smart phone, tablet, laptop or PC. MiniMe works with all platforms: IOS, OSX, Android and Windows.

What kind of digital formats can I play?

All popular audio and video formats can be played on MiniMe.

What kind of wired analog sources can I use with MiniMe?

MiniMe features an RCA Line-in analog input. All your wired sound sources such as a Cd player, Mp3 player or even a turntable can be plugged right in. Furthermore a guitar input jack turns MiniMe into a guitar amplifier. Plug your guitar and rock in style!

STREAMING MUSIC

(Bluetooth)

How easy is it to connect my device and start playing music?

Piece of cake. Press MiniMe's nose and turn on the Bluetooth on your device. Select MiniMe on the menu and you are ready to roll. You only need to pair the device once, it will remain stored in its memory for future use.

How close does my device need to be to MiniMe?

Within 12 meters / 40 feet.

USING MINIME AS A MEDIA CENTER

(WiFi)

How do i connect MiniMe to a TV?

Use the HDMI port with the appropriate HDMI cable (not included).

Do I need access to Wi-Fi or a home internet connection?

You will need that option when you'll have MiniMe connected to a TV. This way MiniMe turns into an open source Media Center that runs Kodi (XBMC) and can browse and view photos, HD videos, podcasts and music from internet, your local network or a hard drive using only a few buttons.

How do I stream music and HD video to MiniMe?

Connect MiniMe to a TV set via the HDMI port. Press MiniMe's nose and that’s it! You will see Kodi booting on your screen. For a detailed info on how Kodi operates and its limitless possibilities visit Kodi's page here.

Is there anything else i need to know?

Yes. We have integrated a 24-bit DAC that can handle High-resolution streams. This way, every time you use MiniMe as a Media Center warmer and brighter sound is delivered which makes a huge difference on the overall quality of sound either you listen to music or play movies and games.

Got more questions? Feel free to contact us at sales@528Hertz.net

and built to last for many years with all the modern functionalities
in mind but with high aesthetics as well. Its housing is made
entirely with solid wood and is customizable to a great extend. It
may seem small but the sound it produces is powerful. It
is like having two full-range HiFi speakers in one! MiniMe
is here to beat reality. What you'll get, modestly speaking, is even
better from what you see. It is truly a piece of art!

Our 6 axis robot Cnc in action

lower the endless working hours, it will also help 528Hertz become

An estimated budget breakdown analysis is featured in the pie chart below:

story:
If any of you know me - Fox of Jim On Light - I'm a very direct person. I'm not going to be any different here.

I am the guy who makes and keeps the mobile app running. It costs a bit of money to have this outlet available to the world. I'm but one guy with a full-time job and a full-time family to support.

I'm looking for your help in keeping the JimOnLight.com App up and running for the next 5 years. As a bonus if this campaign is fully funded, the app will remain free, become available on the iPad (natively) and become ad-free.

I'm offering you a perk if you fund over $50, of enshrining your name within the app as a supporter. One lucky person will have the opportunity of having their name right under the splash page logo - a la PBS programming thank you's.

The funding breaks down to $600 per year of operation.

Please help keep us running!

Thank you.

story:
Great news!

Now, while on biking adventures, you can ditch the fear of losing connectivity with the world, you don't have to pace yourself  if you want to listen to some music, or record rides, tricks and flips with your GoPro along the way - CycleCharge® is here!



CycleCharge® uses electricity generated by your bike’s dynamo or power hub, converts it from unstable and variable alternating, to stable pulsed, direct current limited to 5.02V/500mA, which is equivalent to the standard voltage of your PC’s or Mac’s USB socket. 

So, to put it in simple terms, anything chargeable via standard USB port is chargeable using CycleCharge®, be it your smartphone, tablet, mp3 player, digital or GoPro camera. 



FEATURES



BENEFITS

Freedom to move without any unnecessary delays is crucial for most  long- distance bikers we've met, and we've met quite a few. Since you depend on weather conditions, sit-downs for the sake of charging your batteries can easily a take couple of hours of your precious good-to-ride time, not to mention the price of drinks you're obliged to pay if you occupy seats somewhere (that is around 2 euros per person for every coffee break). 
No more rationalization, when it comes to electricity-based equipment: music, internet, GPS, GoProCam - as long as it's charges on a usb adapter – you're safe! For extended usage order the external battery: it's 5600 mAh will allow you to charge your phone fully two times, even if you're not peddling.
Think about shelter, think about food, about the condition of your tires, but DON'T think about  electricity any more.

HOW IT WORKS

People often ask me “What will happen if I pedal really fast, or go down a hill, will anything happen to my phone or to whatever I’m charging?”



Well, that’s why CycleCharge® is here, to prevent anything happening to your beloved device while you’re charging it. It starts the charging process  the moment you start moving faster than 3 km/h (for reference, the average walking speed is about 5 km/h), but it doesn’t care if you’re going 60 km/h.


LETS GET PHYSICAL

With it’s housing made from an improved form of acrylic glass, filled with UV stable polymer resin to protect the inside of the device, CycleCharge® becomes a mean little robust charger, very much resistant to all the things that may hit you along the way like water, dust, shocks and hits, high and low temperatures ranging from -10 to +70 degrees Celsius. CycleCharge® always does it’s job, reliably, regardless of your speed, weather and all other misfortunes. Except robbery. To prevent that, CycleCharge® is easily mounted to your bikes frame using Velcro tape, so it can be  taken off easily in case you are leaving your bicycle unattended. 

With it’s small dimensions (59,2 x 30,2 x 10mm) and sleek, modern design, it is no problem of storing CycleCharge® in your pocket and not even know it is there.


TIMELINE




FAQ's:
Q: Will this device turn me into a irresistible person?
A: It most certainly will. 
Q: If I get lost in the woods, can I make a shelter out of it?
A: No doubt. With a bit of patience, CycleCharge® can be a two-room tent with a small, lovely bathroom.
Q: Where are we going with this conversation right now?
A: We're just having fun. All the informations is up, Super simple, yet, in details. 

In case you still have questions, feel free to ask us directly. 
Thank you for your interest. 


Founder:
Goran Sajdl

Founder:
Goran Sajdl

story:
"Sinclair turns Raspberry Pi into a consumer handheld. Raspberry Pi has been used in the design of its first consumer handheld, a credit-card sized micro-computer from Sinclair, one of the most famous UK brands in computing."  Electronics Weekly

"This Rasberry Pi handheld wants to be every gadget in the world"  Engadget

"Poco serves as actioncam, multimedia player, gaming machine and more"  Gizmag

WHAT IS Poco® (from $15-299) ?

Poco® is a credit card size and multi-function micro computer from Sinclair that is powered by the open source and easy to modify Raspberry Pi® chipset. Poco® is an Action camera, a Gaming console, a Hi-Res music player & recorder (up to 18x higher quality than MP3) plus an internet ready web browser in your pocket. Poco® includes a built-in Raspberry Pi chipset (compute module) so no separate Raspberry Pi® purchase is necessary. 

Poco® was invented by Grant Sinclair - the youngest next generation Sinclair inventor, (from the same family who invented the worlds first pocket TV, worlds first slimline pocket calculator, worlds first mass market digital watch, worlds first flat screen TV, the UKs best selling personal computer throughout 1980s together with pioneering early miniature Hi-Fi).

"Poco is a Creative tool that can become what you want it to be" - HowieB (Wolf of Wall Street track producer, trip hop godfather and producer for Björk, Tricky, RyCooder, Annie Lennox and more).

Superlight dual Action camera

Poco® can shoot full HD 1080p video + 5MP still images from its dual front and back cameras and includes a superbright and programmable Cree LED flash. A built-in 1/4 inch action mount accepts standard universal attachments such as a bike mount, car windshield mount, helmet mount or tripod, Poco® is around half the size and weight of competing compact cameras.

Use Poco®'s ultra sharp 2.8 inch IPS touchscreen display for playback of content or easily connect Poco® to your HDTV or projector using its built-in micro HDMI port.

Pocketable gaming device

Download new Raspberry Pi® games such as Minecraft or classics such as Quake from the online Pi community (classic console emulators also available) and use the twin analogue joysticks with centre push switches together with dual shoulder buttons (all controls programmable) for ultimate tactile gaming experience.

Hi-Res music player & recorder 

Poco® can play and record next generation Hi-Res audio music that is studio quality and up to 18x higher quality than MP3 - great for musicians and Audiophile connoisseurs. A built-in dynamic speaker and twin stereo high fidelity microphones get you grooving straight out of the box. Alternatively you may prefer to plug Poco® into your own sound system or home studio recording setup using Poco®'s built-in micro USB hub (3x micro USB ports). Use low cost micro USB (mobile phone type) earbuds or instead connect your own quality headphones using a micro USB adapter (available to purchase from leading electronic component stockists).

Internet ready, integrated Wi-Fi

Being internet ready, use Poco®'s built-in Wi-Fi (802.11) to surf the web and download content from web sites such as HDtracks, Naim Label, Linn Records, Technics Tracks, Onkyo Music and other labels trail blazing next generation 24-bit sound (store your content on removable microSD cards).

Creative tool

Poco® is packed to the max full of cutting edge programmable hardware and has over 400 miniature components 'shoe-horned' under its hood casing. Around 60 of these are key components and the very latest 'wearable' technology and some examples include: a GPS, a Digital barometer, a 3-axis gyroscope, a 3-axis accelerometer, and a 3-axis magnetometer. We have also designed Poco® to be easy to 'break out' of or modify so anyone can modify the Poco® to turn it into other gadgets - the opposite of conventional gadget design which tends to offer a closed platform.

  • Action camera
  • Gaming console
  • Hi-Res music player & recorder - up to 18x higher quality than MP3
  • Internet ready web browser with integrated Wi-Fi 
  • GPS tracker - ideal to keep track of your kids, parents, rockets or drones
  • Fitness tracker - the pocketable size makes Poco® very portable
  • Wi-Fi phone - make free video calls with no mobile phone contract
  • Powered by the open source + hackable Raspberry Pi® chipset

The cost of Poco® is far less than if you were to purchase a Raspberry Pi® together with all the different hardware boards (camera boards, TFT screen, Wi-Fi dongle, battery, GPS module etc etc) purchased separately - we designed Poco® to give you the ultimate compact & customisable hardware specification at an affordable price.

Poco® comes with a handy Creative instruction manual (CD booklet size) that teaches you how to turn the Poco® into many other exciting projects, some examples include: a Dash cam (for bike or car), A free Wi-Fi video phone (no mobile phone contract required), a Fitness Tracker, Robot controller, a Baby monitor, Bike light or Satellite Navigation system. With software such as RasPiConnect, it is even possible to control the Poco® using your mobile phone. For example, you could use Poco® as a CCTV device for your home that can stream video content to your iPhone® or Android® device when you are out of town. Or more simplistically, you could use Poco® as a backup battery device for your mobile phone. These are some of our ideas - but we are sure you will come up with many more. We are excited to see the Poco® community develop and you will be able to submit the way you use your Poco® to our website.

Engaging learning device

Increasingly in schools, coding is appearing on the curriculum. Poco® micro computer makes it easier for teachers and children to begin to understand how computers work, to enjoy the creative possibilities that digital technology offers, and have access to the Raspberry Pi® community for support.

There are many features that make Poco® an exciting learning device which will entertain and inspire the youngest creative mind. The small size makes it easy for children to hold and the exciting tech packed inside can be unlocked with simple programming - ideal for coding beginners. Extra peripherals can be added to make coding easier such as a standard USB keyboard or mouse and regular desktop computer monitor (adapter required).

An optional macro lens add-on accessory is available for detailed, close up photography.

Young people can also use programs such as Scratch: a visual programming tool which allows the user to create animations and games with a drag-and-drop interface. It allows you to create your own computer games, interactive stories, and animations using some programming techniques without actually having to write code.

Poco® includes everything you need to make exciting creative work and ships with an ultra thin gift box that can house a microSD card, plus supplied pill stylus, macro lens add-on and Creative/instruction manual.

Supertough construction

Poco®'s body is made from next generation of metal alloy which is highly robust and ultra light weight. The simplistic two-part body construction makes Poco®'s hardware easy to access for potential user repair, upgrading or modification. The build quality of Poco® feels premium to the highest level and makes existing mobile phone style glass body construction feel vulnerable and obsolete.

Background to the invention

Regarding Poco®, in the words of Hermann Hauser (founder of ARM, a company who have sold over 50 Billion micro processors and Acorn Computers - whose BBC Micro computers dominated the UK educational computer market during the 1980s): "As you would expect from a Sinclair product, it looks very cool".

The idea of Poco® was originally conceived some time ago after inventor, (Grant Sinclair, now aged 42, originally from Cambridge) learnt about the amazing success of the easy to use handheld Flip video camera from Pure Digital Technologies which eventually sold in millions of units. Grant's idea was to take aspects of the bulky Flip camera design but improve it by using newer and next generation mobile phone technology to miniaturise the form factor and produce a similar concept but packed into a much neater, credit card size footprint and using high-end build quality inspired by the famous Minox spy camera from 1932. Many of the selected hardware components were way ahead of their time and the smallest or thinnest in the world such as a wafer thin Piezoelectric speaker from Murata of Japan, an energy efficient Active Matrix OLED display module from CMEL of Taiwan and a unique miniature camera module with ultra-fast Autofocus, continuous variable aperture & shutter from Digital Imaging Systems of Germany. The original Poco® concept was very well received and immediately received letters of interest to sell or license from leading camera distributors worldwide - however some of the technology involved was very new and difficult to secure some of these specialist components in reliable volume supply. However, this early success spurred Grant on to re-engineer the Poco® to take advantage of industrial grade components that were more readily available and likely to be around for longer such as a thin type, high contrast IPS display module, a miniature Dynamic speaker from Knowles® and the Raspberry Pi® compute module. At the same time other hardware feature sets were added to take advantage of the open source Raspberry Pi® community such as gaming functionality (to rival the popular Nintendo DS™ handheld console) and 24-bit audio playback & recording functionality (the next generation of hi-resolution sound). 
The first crude (3D printed) Poco® prototype proved the initial concept worked:

Poco® was improved further by adding a standard quarter action mount, making it compatible with many camera mount accessories (car and bike etc) and therefore a stronger potential competitor to the leading GoPro® action camera which has now become the best selling camera in the world. Poco® is now ready for launching to the mass market, and we are asking you to support this campaign to turn Poco® from working prototype into a shipping product direct to you our campaign supporters.

Our team developing Poco®


Our core team of experts have years of experience between us, we also bring in leading consultants in their field when necessary. Because we are a relatively small team, we are fast moving - completing most tasks in-house means we can implement ideas swiftly and effectively, avoiding the unnecessary bureaucratic procedures often imposed on larger organisations (e.g board meetings etc). 

The Sinclair design team currently consist of the following members:

  • Grant - Inventor, Designer & CEO
  • Cassiel - Creative Partner, education & funding advisor
  • Nigel - Electronics Designer specialising in tablet hardware & PCB architecture
  • Chris - Electronics Manager, including regulatory compliance
  • Andrew - CAD engineer & Production Manager
  • Jack - Film and Music production, editing

In addition, two of the largest electronics component distributors in the world (Premier Farnell plc and RS Components) have both offered to support Sinclair by overlooking the manufacturing of Poco® including introductions to relevant manufacturing partners e.g Sony® of Wales in UK (one of the key manufacturers of the original and current Raspberry Pi® product range).

Where are we with the project regarding timeline for completion?

We estimated at the outset that the complete Poco® electronics development would take around 32 weeks. So far we have completed the PCB schematics and are close to finishing the PCB design files for pre-production, therefore around 15 weeks into the project. The next stage is to produce a pilot batch of PCBs for pre-production manufacture which power up and allow basic operation, ready for compliance testing. As soon as we receive cleared funds from Indiegogo, we can order the metal body tooling which has a lead time of 7-9 weeks upon approval and then a further 4 weeks upon approval of first article samples.

What is the funding for?

The funding is to complete the electronics development, to tool the metal body casing and other ancillary parts. We aim to deliver you a product to the highest quality standards which takes time to get right. 

In addition, part of the funding is to be used for extending our current filed intellectual property (UK patent pending and European Design registration) into multiple territories worldwide - our current UK patent pending allows us a period of grace by which to file into other territories, therefore our IP is currently covered worldwide for the short term which should hopefully discourage inferior and low quality (counterfeit) copies entering the market. Note: we are working with brand protection agencies: Mark Monitor® (who cleared up the problem of copies for Duracell® and Gillette®, whereby 50% of units sold worldwide were counterfeit) together with React® (who a not-for-profit organization with over 20 years experience in fighting counterfeit trade).

Our 2nd short film of the Poco®:) 


Risks and challenges

Our team are Sinclair Mobile Ltd, the next generation of Sinclair computing and we are raising funds to take Poco® micro computer from working prototype stage and develop for mass production (UK manufacturing planned).

From experience we have learnt to develop the Poco® using mostly established technology that already works (rather than pie in the sky unproven tech) and have now got all the key features of Poco® running well on the existing prototype. In addition, we have been very careful to select key components that are industrial grade and likely to be around for some time (in an effort to avoid the End Of Life obstacle scenario that hi-tec companies often come up against, when developing innovative new consumer products).

Perhaps the largest risk is with the manufacture of the thin wall body 
housing (0.6mm wall thickness) as most suppliers have a limit of 1mm minimal wall thickness. However, we have identified two suppliers who specialise in thin wall housings (one of which is a Tier 1 level supplier of leading mobile phone brands) and both suppliers are very confident they can achieve the wall thickness we need.

Because we are pushing the boundaries of how many electronic components can be crammed inside Poco's casing (over 400 parts), we had some initial concerns regarding the build-up of heat inside the case. We therefore engineered Poco's casing to double as a heat sink and have successfully tested the device, including with running the CPU at a much faster rate (enabling overclocking, therefore faster processing) - we have since filed patents protecting our intellectual property in this and several other aspects of the product design & engineering.

Another problem is tracking the multi-layer PCB so it hooks up all the ancillary components. For this we have come up with a very neat multi-layer, flex-rigid PCB solution that connects everything together and our engineers have vast experience of designing these type of PCB stacks. We are currently talking to Sony in Wales, UK plus other leading blue chip OEMs regarding manufacturing the Poco®.

We also need to get Poco® to be EMI compliant, so it doesn't interfere with other electrical devices. Whilst this is usually a relatively straight forward process, it requires expert knowledge and can be expensive to implement as often requires many stages of rigorous testing to get the product to a shipping state. Other regulatory standards that need implementing include CE marking plus RTTE, EMC, ROHS and WEEE directives. Poco's electronics will need to be tested to comply with IEC EN 60950 safety standards. This will be a key stage in the process of getting Poco® to you.

Coming from the Sinclair family of inventors and with a background in product design (including electronics miniaturisation), helps because we have the experience and industry contacts to bring a product like Poco® to life. With the right level of funding, we are certain to deliver our campaign supporters a quality product that is high tech to the highest spec and packed with cool and cutting edge features.

For media inquiries, please email us at: SinclairMobileMedia@gmail.com.

Copyright Grant Sinclair, London UK 2015. E & OE. 
Raspberry Pi® is a trademark of the Raspberry Pi Foundation.
Poco® and SinclairMobile® are trademarks owned by Grant Sinclair.
story_txt:
"Sinclair turns Raspberry Pi into a
consumer handheld. Raspberry Pi has been used in the design of its first
consumer handheld, a credit-card sized micro-computer from Sinclair, one of the
most famous UK brands in computing."  Electronics
Weekly

"This Rasberry Pi handheld wants to be every gadget in the world"  Engadget
"Poco serves as
actioncam, multimedia player, gaming machine and more"  GizmagWHAT IS Poco® (from $15-299) ?Poco® is a credit card size and multi-function micro computer from Sinclair that is powered by the open source and easy to modify Raspberry Pi® chipset. Poco® is an Action camera, a Gaming console, a Hi-Res music player & recorder (up to 18x higher quality than MP3) plus an internet ready web browser in your pocket. Poco® includes a built-in Raspberry Pi chipset (compute module) so no separate Raspberry Pi® purchase is necessary. Poco® was invented by Grant Sinclair - the youngest next generation Sinclair inventor, (from the same family who invented the worlds first pocket TV, worlds first slimline pocket calculator, worlds first mass market digital watch, worlds first flat screen TV, the UKs best selling personal computer throughout 1980s together with pioneering early miniature Hi-Fi)."Poco is a Creative tool that can become what you want it to be" - HowieB (Wolf of Wall Street track producer, trip hop godfather and producer for Björk, Tricky, RyCooder, Annie Lennox and more).Superlight dual Action cameraPoco® can shoot full HD 1080p video + 5MP still images from its dual front and back cameras and includes a superbright and programmable Cree LED flash. A built-in 1/4 inch action mount accepts standard universal attachments such as a bike mount, car windshield mount, helmet mount or tripod, Poco® is around half the size and weight of competing compact cameras.Use Poco®'s ultra sharp 2.8 inch IPS touchscreen display for playback of content or easily connect Poco® to your HDTV or projector using its built-in micro HDMI port.Pocketable gaming deviceDownload new Raspberry Pi® games such as Minecraft or classics such as Quake from the online Pi community (classic console emulators also available) and use the twin analogue joysticks with centre push switches together with dual shoulder buttons (all controls programmable) for ultimate tactile gaming experience.Hi-Res music player & recorder Poco® can play and record next generation Hi-Res audio music that is studio quality and up to 18x higher quality than MP3 - great for musicians and Audiophile connoisseurs. A built-in dynamic speaker and twin stereo high fidelity microphones get you grooving straight out of the box. Alternatively you may prefer to plug Poco® into your own sound system or home studio recording setup using Poco®'s built-in micro USB hub (3x micro USB ports). Use low cost micro USB (mobile phone type) earbuds or instead connect your own quality headphones using a micro USB adapter (available to purchase from leading electronic component stockists).Internet ready, integrated Wi-FiBeing internet ready, use Poco®'s built-in Wi-Fi (802.11) to surf the web and download content from web sites such as HDtracks, Naim Label, Linn Records, Technics Tracks, Onkyo Music and other labels trail blazing next generation 24-bit sound (store your content on removable microSD cards).Creative toolPoco® is packed to the max full of cutting edge programmable hardware and has over 400 miniature components 'shoe-horned' under its hood casing. Around 60 of these are key components and the very latest 'wearable' technology and some examples include: a GPS, a Digital barometer, a 3-axis gyroscope, a 3-axis accelerometer, and a 3-axis magnetometer. We have also designed Poco® to be easy to 'break out' of or modify so anyone can modify the Poco® to turn it into other gadgets - the opposite of conventional gadget design which tends to offer a closed platform.
Action camera
Gaming console
Hi-Res music player & recorder - up to 18x higher quality than MP3
Internet ready web browser with integrated Wi-Fi 
GPS tracker - ideal to keep track of your kids, parents, rockets or drones
Fitness tracker - the pocketable size makes Poco® very portable
Wi-Fi phone - make free video calls with no mobile phone contract
Powered by the open source + hackable Raspberry Pi® chipset
The cost of Poco® is far less than if you were to purchase a Raspberry Pi® together with all the different hardware boards (camera boards, TFT screen, Wi-Fi dongle, battery, GPS module etc etc) purchased separately - we designed Poco® to give you the ultimate compact & customisable hardware specification at an affordable price.Poco® comes with a handy Creative instruction manual (CD booklet size) that teaches you how to turn the Poco® into many other exciting projects, some examples include: a Dash cam (for bike or car), A free Wi-Fi video phone (no mobile phone contract required), a Fitness Tracker, Robot controller, a Baby monitor, Bike light or Satellite Navigation system. With software such as RasPiConnect, it is even possible to control the Poco® using your mobile phone. For example, you could use Poco® as a CCTV device for your home that can stream video content to your iPhone® or Android® device when you are out of town. Or more simplistically, you could use Poco® as a backup battery device for your mobile phone. These are some of our ideas - but we are sure you will come up with many more. We are excited to see the Poco® community develop and you will be able to submit the way you use your Poco® to our website.

story:
About a year ago two dudes realized how cool it would be to know exactly what's on tap around town in one app. Well, we worked our butts off and now we have over 2400 taps in Florida that are nearly 90% accurate at any given time.  The reception has been absurd.  We've had investors approach us and we've thought about going that route.  But before we do, we figured why not see if the people who are going to use this actually want to own a piece of it.  So here's our campaign.

We want to do more with Tap Map. We want Android and iPhone apps.  We want cover the entire state. We want notifications. We want the slickest interface you've ever seen. So we are coming to you to get some help and giving back to you in return...in more ways than one.  Also we have some plans that are so friggin' sweet we can't talk about them yet.

Below you can see the Android app is underway (look at all those up to date tap lists!), lots of functionality done but it's just not pretty yet and with these funds we can make it super slick!

We need money for servers, merch, developers and so on. But we are giving away pieces of ownership in the company amongst many other fun rewards.  So how 'bout it.  Let's blow this sucker up!

Next regions to bad added THIS MONTH:

Jacksonville area

Gainesville area

Miami to Ft Lauderdale

Naples to Ft Meyers
